matthewm101

Class HeatmapGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • matthewm101.HeatmapGenerator

  • public class HeatmapGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that stores the parsed data from an OpenStreetMap xml file and uses the data to produce a heatmap.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  HeatmapGenerator.HeatmapGeneratedHandler
      Defines that a class can respond to TaskGenerate or TaskRegenerate.
      static interface  HeatmapGenerator.HeatmapSetupHandler
      Defines that a class can respond to TaskSetup finishing.
      class  HeatmapGenerator.TaskGenerate
      A task that, when executed, will generate a heatmap.
      class  HeatmapGenerator.TaskRegenerate
      A task that, when executed, will generate a heatmap.
      class  HeatmapGenerator.TaskSetup
      A task that, when executed, will generate the POI list.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage backgroundImage
      The background image for the heatmap.
      private java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> criteriaList
      A list of criteria, given as key-value pairs.
      private double[] distances
      For each pixel in the heatmap's image, this returns the distance to the closest point of interest that meets the given criteria.
      private HeatmapGenerator.HeatmapGeneratedHandler generatedHandler
      A reference to a menu that will need to be notified when a generate task (AKA creating and painting the heatmap) is complete.
      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage heatmapImage
      The translucent heatmap image that is generated by this class.
      private double maxDistance
      The maximum distance that a pixel can be from a point of interest in order to be painted by the heatmap.
      private double maxLat
      The maximum latitude of the map data's bounds.
      private double maxLon
      The maximum longitude of the map data's bounds.

      The minimum latitude of the map data's bounds.

      The minimum longitude of the map data's bounds.

      For each pixel in the heatmap's image, this returns the reference to the closest point of interest that meets the given criteria.
      private java.util.List<PointOfInterest> poiList
      A list containing every point of interest parsed from the XML file.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<PointOfInterest>> poiTagMap
      A map of lists that contain all points of interest that possess a tag that has a specific key.
      private javax.swing.JProgressBar progressBar
      A reference to a menu's progress bar, which will be updated as certain lengthy tasks run.
      private HeatmapGenerator.HeatmapSetupHandler setupHandler
      A reference to a menu that will need to be notified when a setup task (AKA parsing the XML file) is complete.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> valueTagMap
      A map of sets that contain all values that are bound to certain keys within the tags of all the points of interest.
      private java.io.File xmlLocation
      The location of the XML file that contains the map data.

    • Field Detail

      • poiList

        private java.util.List<PointOfInterest> poiList
        A list containing every point of interest parsed from the XML file.

      • poiTagMap

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<PointOfInterest>> poiTagMap
        A map of lists that contain all points of interest that possess a tag that has a specific key. For example, poiTagMap.get("name") will return all points of interest with a defined name.

      • valueTagMap

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> valueTagMap
        A map of sets that contain all values that are bound to certain keys within the tags of all the points of interest. For example, valueTagMap.get("name") will return the names of all points of interest.

      • criteriaList

        private java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> criteriaList
        A list of criteria, given as key-value pairs. When a heatmap is generated, each point of interest represented in the heatmap must meet at least one of these criteria.

      • backgroundImage

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage backgroundImage
        The background image for the heatmap.

      • xmlLocation

        private java.io.File xmlLocation
        The location of the XML file that contains the map data.

      • minLat

        private double minLat
        The minimum latitude of the map data's bounds.

      • maxLat

        private double maxLat
        The maximum latitude of the map data's bounds.

      • minLon

        private double minLon
        The minimum longitude of the map data's bounds.

      • maxLon

        private double maxLon
        The maximum longitude of the map data's bounds.

      • heatmapImage

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage heatmapImage
        The translucent heatmap image that is generated by this class.

      • progressBar

        private javax.swing.JProgressBar progressBar
        A reference to a menu's progress bar, which will be updated as certain lengthy tasks run.

      • setupHandler

        private HeatmapGenerator.HeatmapSetupHandler setupHandler
        A reference to a menu that will need to be notified when a setup task (AKA parsing the XML file) is complete.

      • generatedHandler

        private HeatmapGenerator.HeatmapGeneratedHandler generatedHandler
        A reference to a menu that will need to be notified when a generate task (AKA creating and painting the heatmap) is complete.

      • distances

        private double[] distances
        For each pixel in the heatmap's image, this returns the distance to the closest point of interest that meets the given criteria.

      • nearestPOIs

        private PointOfInterest[] nearestPOIs
        For each pixel in the heatmap's image, this returns the reference to the closest point of interest that meets the given criteria.

      • maxDistance

        private double maxDistance
        The maximum distance that a pixel can be from a point of interest in order to be painted by the heatmap. By default, this is 5km, stored as degrees of latitude/longitude.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HeatmapGenerator

        public HeatmapGenerator(java.io.File xml,
                        java.awt.image.BufferedImage bg,
                        javax.swing.JProgressBar progress)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a new HeatmapGenerator object with the specified dimension, progress bar reference, and event handler.
        Parameters:
        xml - The xml file to be read.
        bg - The background image for the heatmap.
        progress - A reference to the progress bar.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file is not found

    • Method Detail

      • getBackgroundImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBackgroundImage()
        Returns the background image for this generator.
        Returns:
        The background image

      • getHeatmapImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getHeatmapImage()
        Returns the heatmap image for this generator.
        Returns:
        The heatmap image

      • addCriterion

        public void addCriterion(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.String value)
        Adds a criterion that will be used to filter the POIS used to generate a heatmap. The heatmap will represent the distance from a specific pixel to the closest POI that fulfills at least one of the criteria.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the tag each POI must have. Cannot be null.
        value - The value that must be matched to a key. If this is null, all POIs that have the key will be matched. If this is not null, all POIs that have the key and have this value mapped to the key will be matched.

      • removeAllCriteria

        public void removeAllCriteria()
        Removes all criteria from the criteria list. This is meant to be called when the criteria are changed.

      • setProgressBarToUpdate

        public void setProgressBarToUpdate(javax.swing.JProgressBar bar)
        Sets the JProgressBar reference that will be updated as the heatmap is generated.
        Parameters:
        bar - The bar to keep updated.

      • getLatFromY

        public double getLatFromY(int y)
        Given the coordinate of a pixel in the image, returns the latitude of the center of the pixel. Note: "in the center of the pixel" means that if the latitude bounds are 0 and 1 and the image has a height of 100, getLatFromY(0) would return 0.005.
        Parameters:
        y - The y-coordinate of the pixel.
        Returns:
        The latitude represented by the pixel.

      • getLonFromX

        public double getLonFromX(int x)
        Given the coordinate of a pixel in the image, returns the longitude of the center of the pixel. Note: "in the center of the pixel" means that if the longitude bounds are 0 and 1 and the image has a width of 100, getLonFromX(0) would return 0.005.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the pixel.
        Returns:
        The longitude represented by the pixel.

      • getPOITagMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<PointOfInterest>> getPOITagMap()
        Returns a map that contains the list of points of interest that contain a certain key.
        Returns:
        The map

      • getValueTagMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getValueTagMap()
        Returns a map that contains the set of values that are paired to a certain key in at least one point of interest.
        Returns:
        The map

      • setMaxDistance

        public void setMaxDistance(double dist)
        Sets the maximum distance that a pixel must be from a point of interest to be colored in the heatmap. Note: the parameter for this function should be in kilometers, as it will be converted to map degrees using the conversion factor 111 km = 1 degree of latitude/longitude.
        Parameters:
        dist - The maximum distance in kilometers.

      • getNearestPOI

        public PointOfInterest getNearestPOI(int x,
                                     int y)
        Returns the nearest POI, based on a pair of coordinate from the background image.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        Returns:
        The POI that is closest to the given coordinates

      • getDistanceToNearestPOI

        public double getDistanceToNearestPOI(int x,
                                      int y)
        Returns the distance to the nearest POI in kilometers, based on a pair of coordinates from the background image.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        Returns:
        The distance to the nearest POI, in kilometers

      • getGenerateTask

        public HeatmapGenerator.TaskGenerate getGenerateTask(HeatmapGenerator.HeatmapGeneratedHandler handler)
        Returns a TaskGenerate that can be executed.
        Parameters:
        handler - A class that will be notified when the task finishes.
        Returns:
        The task.

      • dist

        public static double dist(double x1,
                          double y1,
                          double x2,
                          double y2)
        An implementation of the distance formula; returns the distance from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2).
        Parameters:
        x1 - x-coordinate of first point
        y1 - y-coordinate of first point
        x2 - x-coordinate of second point
        y2 - y-coordinate of second point
        Returns:
        the distance between the two points
